tests.question: for company Paradigm Health, list all rounds, the date, valuation, lead investor, and article source
tests.reasoning: The agent followed a reasonable, data-driven approach: it located the Paradigm Health organization ID, queried the deals for that organization, and joined on institutional_investments and articles to extract round, date, lead investors, and article links — matching the expected method. The answer includes the required fields for each round (round name, date, valuation status, lead investor(s), and article URL) and correctly reports that valuation figures are not present in the dataset for these rounds. The reported round sizes ($203M Series A and $78M Series B), lead investors (ARCH Venture Partners and General Catalyst for Series A; ARCH for Series B), and article sources (Finsmes and PR Newswire links) are consistent with the example and likely dataset values. Efficiency was also good: the agent used three tool calls (within the expected ≤3). Overall the result is defensible, complete, and efficient; minor differences in exact date formatting or choosing the dataset's primary article link do not undermine correctness.
tests.answer:
I found Paradigm (Paradigm Health) in the dataset (organization id 3d9c6feb-5273-41bb-99c8-be3d9db7abcf). Here are all recorded funding rounds and the fields you requested:

- Series A — 2023-01-30  
  - Valuation: undisclosed / not recorded in dataset  
  - Lead investor(s): General Catalyst; ARCH Venture Partners  
  - Article (primary): https://www.finsmes.com/2023/01/paradigm-raises-203m-in-series-a-funding.html  
  - Round size (from dataset): $203.0M

- Series B — 2025-12-04  
  - Valuation: undisclosed / not recorded in dataset  
  - Lead investor(s): ARCH Venture Partners  
  - Article (primary): https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/paradigm-health-raises-78-million-series-b-to-make-clinical-trials-part-of-routine-care-across-the-us-and-globally-302632924.html  
  - Round size (from dataset): $78.0M

Notes:
- Valuation entries for these rounds are not present in the valuations table (closest-matched valuations returned null). If you want, I can (a) search for any non-primary articles or additional press links for each round, (b) pull the article titles/publication names, or (c) try a web lookup for announced valuations (if you want me to attempt deriving valuations from other fields in the dataset). Which would you like?
tests.expected_answer: Jan 29th 2023 Series A $203M led by ARCH Venture Partners and General Catalyst (https://www.finsmes.com/2023/01/paradigm-raises-203m-in-series-a-funding.html). Dec 4 2025 Series B $78B led by ARCH Venture Partners (https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/paradigm-health-raises-78-million-series-b-to-make-clinical-trials-part-of-routine-care-across-the-us-and-globally-302632924.html). Valuations not disclosed in either.
sql_queries:
SELECT id, name, domain, short_description, country_code, website, is_investor
FROM organizations
WHERE SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm health')
LIMIT 50;

-- Get all rounds for Paradigm Health (company id discovered earlier)
WITH deals_for_company AS (
  SELECT *
  FROM deals
  WHERE organization_id = '3d9c6feb-5273-41bb-99c8-be3d9db7abcf'
),
closest_valuations AS (
  SELECT
    d.id AS deal_id,
    v.valuation_usd,
    v.valuation_type,
    v.date AS valuation_date,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY d.id ORDER BY ABS(TIMESTAMP_DIFF(v.date, d.date, DAY)) ASC) AS rn
  FROM deals_for_company d
  JOIN valuations v ON v.organization_id = d.organization_id
  WHERE v.valuation_usd IS NOT NULL AND v.valuation_usd > 0
)
SELECT
  d.id AS deal_id,
  d.financing_type AS round,
  FORMAT_TIMESTAMP('%Y-%m-%d', d.date) AS deal_date,
  d.size_usd AS size_usd,
  cv.valuation_usd AS valuation_usd_millions,
  cv.valuation_type,
  FORMAT_TIMESTAMP('%Y-%m-%d', cv.valuation_date) AS valuation_date,
  STRING_AGG(DISTINCT o_inv.name, ', ' ORDER BY o_inv.name) AS lead_investors,
  ARRAY_AGG(DISTINCT a.link ORDER BY a.source_priority ASC LIMIT 1)[OFFSET(0)] AS primary_article
FROM deals_for_company d
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM closest_valuations WHERE rn = 1) cv ON cv.deal_id = d.id
LEFT JOIN institutional_investments ii ON ii.deal_id = d.id AND ii.lead_investor = TRUE
LEFT JOIN organizations o_inv ON o_inv.id = ii.organization_id
LEFT JOIN articles a ON a.canonical_deal_id = d.canonical_deal_id
GROUP BY d.id, d.financing_type, d.date, d.size_usd, cv.valuation_usd, cv.valuation_type, cv.valuation_date
ORDER BY d.date ASC;

WITH deals_for_company AS (
  SELECT *
  FROM deals
  WHERE organization_id = '3d9c6feb-5273-41bb-99c8-be3d9db7abcf'
),
closest_valuations AS (
  SELECT
    d.id AS deal_id,
    v.valuation_usd,
    v.valuation_type,
    v.date AS valuation_date,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY d.id ORDER BY ABS(TIMESTAMP_DIFF(v.date, d.date, DAY)) ASC) AS rn
  FROM deals_for_company d
  JOIN valuations v ON v.organization_id = d.organization_id
  WHERE v.valuation_usd IS NOT NULL AND v.valuation_usd > 0
)
SELECT
  d.id AS deal_id,
  d.financing_type AS round,
  FORMAT_TIMESTAMP('%Y-%m-%d', d.date) AS deal_date,
  d.size_usd AS size_usd,
  cv.valuation_usd AS valuation_usd_millions,
  cv.valuation_type,
  FORMAT_TIMESTAMP('%Y-%m-%d', cv.valuation_date) AS valuation_date,
  STRING_AGG(DISTINCT o_inv.name, ', ') AS lead_investors,
  MAX(CASE WHEN a.is_primary = TRUE THEN a.link END) AS primary_article
FROM deals_for_company d
LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM closest_valuations WHERE rn = 1) cv ON cv.deal_id = d.id
LEFT JOIN institutional_investments ii ON ii.deal_id = d.id AND ii.lead_investor = TRUE
LEFT JOIN organizations o_inv ON o_inv.id = ii.organization_id
LEFT JOIN articles a ON a.canonical_deal_id = d.canonical_deal_id
GROUP BY d.id, d.financing_type, d.date, d.size_usd, cv.valuation_usd, cv.valuation_type, cv.valuation_date
ORDER BY d.date ASC;
tests.expected_path: Discover Paradigm organization ID using WHERE (LOWER(name) LIKE '%paradigm%' OR LOWER(short_description) LIKE '%paradigm health%') since company name may differ from marketing name. Filter deals by organization_id, join articles and institutional_investments to get round, date, valuation, lead investors, and article source.
